sentences.english: A flock of cawing ravens had just flown up from in front of her.
sentences.chinese: 一群呱呱鸣叫的乌鸦从她面前飞起。

sentences.english: Mc Donald's sell hamburgers-that great American fast food.
sentences.chinese: 麦当劳卖的汉堡包是一顶呱呱的美国快餐。

sentences.english: The wind blows, the moonlight shines on the ground,the frogs croak and insects chirp in the fields.
sentences.chinese: 青蛙呱呱的叫声，和田间昆虫啾唧之声混合在一起。

sentences.english: The mother flew down below and started quacking to her babies above.
sentences.chinese: 母鸭飞了下去，开始朝它上面的宝宝们呱呱叫著。

sentences.english: She is second to none among all the graduates.
sentences.chinese: 在毕业生中她是顶呱呱的一个。

sentences.english: Frog croak, rain will come to.
sentences.chinese: 雨蛙呱呱叫，下雨必来到。

sentences.english: A flying fish is excellent to eat raw and I would not have to cut him up.
sentences.chinese: 飞鱼生吃味道是呱呱叫的，而且不用把它切成小块。

sentences.english: She eis second to none among all the graduates.
sentences.chinese: 在钵毕业生中她是顶呱呱的一个。

sentences.english: "Your stew is excellent, "the old man said.
According to them, this traditional role of education begins almost at birth.
sentences.chinese: 教育的传统角色几乎自婴儿呱呱坠地就开始了。

sentences.english: The raven cawed on the tree.
I was doomed to be a child of poor farming family the minute I was born.
sentences.chinese: 从呱呱落地起，我就注定成了农家的子弟。

sentences.english: The hibernated frogs croak by the river.
sentences.chinese: 河边，冬眠的青蛙呱呱叫着。

definition: (onom.) chirping of insects, sighing noise etc
cuckoo (Cercococcyx spp.)/same as 杜鵑鳥|杜鹃鸟[du4 juan1 niao3]
to cry out/to bark out a sound
(onom.) quack/honk/(northern dialect) very/also pr. [ga1 ga5], [ga2 ga5] etc
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
